articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Beninese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Beninese President
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Thomas Boni Yayi upon his reelection as president of Benin.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president bigger success in his responsible work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman Marked
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers of the DPRK met in Unhung-ri, Thaechon County, North Phyongan Province on Monday to celebrate the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, made a report at the meeting which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il's election to the top post of the NDC provided a sure guarantee for successful accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They noted that he strengthened the DPRK into the state of President Kim Il Sung and applied the Songun politics, making great achievements in the revolution and construction.
					
					 He has energetically led the drive to implement the agricultural policy of the Workers' Party of Korea in every period and at every stage of the developing revolution, they said.
					
					 They stressed that all the agricultural workers should attain the grain production goal for this year with sense of responsibility for the lifeline in improving the people's living standard and devote their patriotic zeal to building a thriving nation.

articles.title: AFC Chairman Arrives
articles.content:
AFC Chairman Arrives
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Mohamed Hammam Saad Al-Abdulla, chairman of the Asian Football Confederation, arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Syrian Embassy Officials
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Syrian Embassy Officials
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Syrian embassy here took place at the DPRK-Syria Friendship Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill on Monday to mark the 65th anniversary of the independence of Syria.  
					 Present there on invitation were Charge d'Affaires Souheil Haidar and officials of the embassy. 
					
					 Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the DPRK-Syria Friendship Association, officials concerned and others.  
					
					 The participants went round production processes of the mill after being briefed on the activities of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu associated with it and its history. 
					
					 They talked to each other about the need to boost the ties between the two countries.

articles.title: Tourism Season Starts
articles.content:
Tourism Season Starts
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Tourism has restarted in scenic spots in the northwestern and western areas of the DPRK.
					 The most famous tourist resort in the areas is Mt. Myohyang. The mountain covers 375 square kilometers with Piro Peak as the highest peak, bordering Hyangsan County, North Phyongan Province, Nyongwon County, South Phyongan Province and Huichon City, Jagang Province.ã€€
					
					 The tourist attractions also include Mt. Jangsu and Mt. Kuwol on the west coast and Mt. Ryongak in Pyongyang.
					
					 Songam and Ryongmun caverns are also visited by many people.
					
					 Tourism has been diversified in the country.

articles.title: Flower Greenhouses under Construction in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Flower Greenhouses under Construction in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- More flower greenhouses have been constructed in Pyongyang.
					 Many greenhouses cultivating flowers were built throughout the country and a modern floricultural institute was constructed in Pyongyang.
					
					 The city plans to build more flower greenhouses in different parts to decorate the streets.
					
					 It has fully secured flower seeds and organized short courses for flower cultivation before the completion of the construction.
					
					 Moranbong District already built a six-block greenhouse of arch style and began cultivating flowers.
					
					 Tongdaewon and Rangnang districts also finished the construction of several greenhouses.

articles.title: Flower Beds Renewed in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Flower Beds Renewed in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Round flower beds in main streets of Pyongyang have been renewed.
					 The rotary flower bed in front of the Sanghung Park has junipers in the center, surrounded by shrubs and flowering plants.
					
					 It is also covered by beautiful turf, fringed by light decorations.
					
					 The rotary near the Kim Man Yu Hospital has a flower bed edged with shrubs.
					
					 Ever-green plants, shrubs and flowers have been planted on round flower beds in other places of the city.

articles.title: Flower-growing Custom of Korean People
articles.content:
Flower-growing Custom of Korean People
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation has a long history of flower cultivation.
					 There was a custom of presenting flowers as a token of love and respect in the period of the three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje, and Silla). 
					
					 Flowers were cultivated in households in the period of Koryo kingdom and Ri Dynasty.
					
					 In summer women dyed their fingernails with pounded balsam blossoms.
					
					 Koryo people used to put flowers in vases in their houses and decorate head, cap and clothes with flowers. 
					
					 In the period of the Ri Dynasty flower symbolizes love, joy, youthfulness and beauty.
					
					 The people in the period favored chrysanthemum.

articles.title: Mt. Kumgang-patterned Writing Materials
articles.content:
Mt. Kumgang-patterned Writing Materials
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Mt. Kumgang-patterned writing materials are on display at the Korean Central History Museum and the Korean Folklore Museum.
					 From the 18th century, many artistic handicrafts patterned with scenic spots have been created in Korea.
					
					 Typical of them are a container for inkstone water, brush stand and brush-cleaning vase patterned with Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 The white porcelains are decorated with a green mountain and crimson peaks. White porcelain is a typical ceramic of the Ri Dynasty. 
					
					 The writing materials show the excellent artistic skill of ceramists in the dynasty.

articles.title: Children's Paduk Contest Held
articles.content:
Children's Paduk Contest Held
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang children's paduk (go) contest took place recently at the Munsu Paduk House.
					 Tens of kindergarteners and primary school pupils in the city participated in the contest.
					
					 The kindergarteners competed in a draw round robin and primary school pupils in a group round robin and knockout.
					
					 Yun Yong Myong, head of the Pyongyang Paduk Centre, told KCNA that the contest scored good results, with the level of the competitors higher than those in the previous contest held last year.

articles.title: Sonhung Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Sonhung Foodstuff Factory
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Sonhung-trademarked foodstuffs are enjoying popularity in the DPRK for their good quality.
					 They are produced by the Sonhung Foodstuff Factory.
					
					 The products are of good shape, size, color and packing.
					
					 The factory, not big as it is, has been streamlined to produce various kinds of foodstuffs like bread, sugar, cake, cooking oil and drinks. 
					
					 All the production processes are controlled by computer.

articles.title: Gilt-Bronze Statue of Wang Kon
articles.content:
Gilt-Bronze Statue of Wang Kon
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- On show at the Korean Central History Museum is a gilt-bronze sedentary statue of Wang Kon in his forties. He is the founder-king of Koryo (918-1392), the first united state of Korea. 
					 The statue was unearthed near the Mausoleum of the king when it was under reconstruction in Juche 86 (1997).
					
					His crown is decorated with the sun and moon symbolizing emperor or king. 
					
					 The statute is preserved as a valuable treasure.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary: Tok Islets Are Part of Inviolable Territory of Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary: Tok Islets Are Part of Inviolable Territory of Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are becoming all the more undisguised in their moves to seize Tok Islets.
					 On March 30 the Japanese authorities instructed officials to make sure that new textbooks for middle schools for 2011 described Tok Islets as part of Japan's territory and the kinds of those books are increased.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, this is a wonton violation of the sovereignty of Korea and an act of aggression.
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea.
					
					 Korea was the first to discover the islets and put them under its jurisdiction. Korea was also the first to reconfirm the dominium over the islets as required by a modern law and declare it internally and externally.
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inalienable territory of Korea in the light of the principle of the prior occupation, the requirement of international law for putting land under one's jurisdiction, as well as in the light of the principle of effective domination and management of it.
					
					 They were marked as part of the territory of Korea on maps drawn by the U.S. and Britain for the confirmation of Japan's territory right after the Second World War.
					
					 These islets were not included in the large Japanese map drawn by the department of staff officers of the Japanese army in 1877 and in another map drawn by the land measurement board in 1899.
					
					 Historical facts prove that Tok Islets are part of the inalienable territory of Korea and this was recognized not only by the international community but by Japan.
					
					 Japan's moves to seize Tok Islets were not prompted by its ignorance of international law or by a wrong understanding of historical data. These are designed to realize its wild ambition for aggression.
					
					 By putting those islets under its control Japan seeks to turn them into an outpost and military bridgehead from which to launch reinvasion of Korea and other Asian countries and to monopolize economic concessions including marine and underwater resources rich in the waters around the islets.
					
					 To this end, it is trying to implant the militarist idea into the Japanese people and youngsters through the education in the distorted history and thus hurl them as a shock brigade and cannon fodder for a seizure of islets and a war.
					
					 This is the most hideous of the crimes being committed by Japan before the times and history.
					
					 What matters is that it is being openly committed under the direct command and manipulation of the Japanese government.
					
					 Japan is persisting in its moves to grab Korea's territory far from making an apology and reparation for the crimes it committed against the Korean people in the past. This is intolerable.
					
					 Tok Islets will always remain part of the inviolable territory of Korea.

articles.title: Anniversary of April 3 Popular Uprising Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of April 3 Popular Uprising Marked 
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday runs a bylined article on the lapse of 63 years since the April 3 Popular Uprising on Jeju Island to drive the aggressors out of south Korea, put an end to the pro-U.S. sycophantic traitorous rule and achieve national reunification. 
					 The article says:
					
					 People of Jeju Island rose in the popular uprising against the U.S. colonial enslavement policy toward south Korea and its moves to split the Korean nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, fully displaying the indomitable fighting spirit and patriotism. 
					
					 Though 63 years have passed since the uprising, the wishes of the south Korean people for independence and reunification have not come true. 
					
					 The uprisers' spirit of resistance is still alive in south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean people are further intensifying their struggle to put an end to the occupation and domination by the U.S., the architect of the split of the Korean nation and the root cause of all its misfortunes and sufferings, and achieve the independent reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Koreans in the north and the south.
					
					 It is impossible to realize the desire of the south Korean people for new politics, new system and new life as long as the U.S. maintains its system for dominating south Korea. This is a bitter lesson drawn by them through the experience of their distress-torn life. 
					
					 All the Koreans in the north, the south and overseas should wage a more dynamic struggle against the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad who deny the north-south declarations, hamstring the efforts to implement them and swim against the trend of the times for dialogue and peace. 
					
					 The south Korean people are sure to emerge victorious in their patriotic cause to drive out the foreign forces and achieve national reunification by carrying forward the indomitable patriotic spirit of the participants in the uprising.

articles.title: S. Korea's War Hysteria Aims at Preempting Attack on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korea's War Hysteria Aims at Preempting Attack on DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The 8th Corps of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage large-scale military exercises in the area of Kangwon Province of south Korea on April 4 and 5, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers are mulling staging the military exercises with all the armed forces under the corps involved, openly blustering that they are aimed at establishing the coordinated combat preparation posture with civilians, administrative officials and police to cope with the "provocations" by someone.
					
					 Their war hysteria aimed at mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK is rendering the situation on the Korean Peninsula unpredictably tense.

articles.title: S. Koreans Slash at Japan's Attempt to Grab Tok Islets
articles.content:
S. Koreans Slash at Japan's Attempt to Grab Tok Islets
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea in a statement on March 30 denounced Japan for its brazen-faced behavior aimed at grabbing Tok Islets.
					 Noting that on the same day the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan passed through screening 12 kinds of textbooks claiming "dominium" over Tok Islets, the statement said:  This is a provocative action fully revealing Japan's aggressive nature.
					
					 It censured Japan for bringing into bolder relief its ambition for grabbing Tok Islets again despite the demand of the Koreans for deleting from the history textbooks the contents beautifying its past crimes.
					
					 We strongly protest against the Japanese government's action of distorting the history and passing through screening textbooks aimed at grabbing Tok Islets, it said.
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean Association of History Teachers issued a statement on April 1 to lodge a protest with Japan against such behavior.

articles.title: Prosecution's Crackdown Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution's Crackdown Flayed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in a commentary on March 30 rapped the puppet prosecution for crackdown upon a progressive figure.
					 The Suwon District Prosecutor's Office charged Yun Ki Jin, co-chairman of the organization, with his letter written in prison. Yun was released in late February.
					
					 The prosecution had already asked for a warrant of detention before his release on the expiration of prison term, the commentary noted, adding: Such repressive action is aimed to block the activities of a progressive personage.
					
					 It demanded that the office stop at once the unreasonable suppression of Yun.

articles.title: Authorities' Submission Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Submission Flailed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference outside the puppet Defense Ministry building on March 30 to denounce the group of traitors for its submission over the fund for transfer of the U.S. military base in south Korea.
					 At the conference speakers noted that the ministry in a briefing on March 29 announced that the fund for transferring the U.S. military base to be borne by south Korea would increase more trillions of won than the amount agreed.
					
					 They charged that the military authorities are scheming to bear even the U.S. share of fund for the transfer of its Second Division base.
					
					 They expressed resentment at the attitude of the authorities who seek to squander a fabulous amount of money collected from the people on transfer of the U.S. military base while turning away the demand of evacuees for vital rights under the pretext of lack of money.
					
					 They warned that the people would certainly punish the present authorities for submission to the U.S.

articles.title: Officials of Chongryon Encourage Koreans in Quake-Stricken Areas
articles.content:
Officials of Chongryon Encourage Koreans in Quake-Stricken Areas 
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on March 28 met and encouraged the chairmen of the Miyagi, Fukushima, Iwate and Ibaraki Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon hit by the earthquake and the ensuing tsunami.
					 Present there were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man and Vice-Chairman Nam Sung U of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and concurrently chairman of its Rights and Welfare Committee, and Kim Hong Chol, director of the General Affairs Department of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee.
					
					 Ho Jong Man learned in detail about the damage done to compatriots, Korean schools and institutions under various prefectural headquarters and expressed deep condolences to the bereaved families of the compatriots killed by the quake and the tsunami.
					
					 He underlined the need to hold significant ceremonies of conveying  the relief fund sent by leader Kim Jong Il not only to the quake-and tsunami-hit compatriots under Chongryon but to all other compatriots and encourage all the officials and compatriots to turn out in the drive to eradicate the aftermath of the disasters with this as a momentum.
					
					 He stressed the need to confirm the whereabouts of compatriots, intensify the rescue activities and take concrete measures to protect students of Korean schools from quake damage and radioactive contamination and rehabilitate school buildings.
					
					 He declared the emergency measure committee of Chongryon would enhance its function and role to conduct more dynamic activities for rescuing the Korean sufferers as a movement involving all organizations and compatriots.
					
					 The chairmen of the headquarters of Chongryon in the affected areas vowed to intensify their activities to rescue the Korean sufferers, bring their living to normal as soon as possible and rehabilitate and reconstruct Korean schools and institutions under the guidance of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website of Peru
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Website of Peru
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on March 14 posted on its Internet website the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Go All Out for Victory in the War".
					 The work, published on June 26, Juche 39 (1950), clarifies that the Fatherland Liberation War is a war of justice for achieving reunification and independence, freedom and democratization of the country. It also indicates the tasks for winning the final victory in the war.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birthday Commemorated in India
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birthday Commemorated in India 
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- India's newspaper Krishna Aberta and magazine International Social Look commemorated the birthday of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The paper on March 28 carried articles under the headline of "On the Occasion of the 99th Birth Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung" with his photo. 
					
					 In an article titled "Mangyongdae" the paper introduced members of the Mangyongdae family and noted that Kim Il Sung left Mangyongdae, his birthplace, with high ambition to liberate the country. 
					
					 Mangyongdae has become a sacred place of the revolution visited by not only the Korean people but also the world progressives following the Juche idea and aspiring after independence, the paper said. 
					
					 The March issue of the magazine said in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, Eternal President" that he is the founder of the DPRK demonstrating its dignity as politico-ideological power, military power and scientific-technological power in the international community. It elaborated on his exploits for nation building. 
					
					 His idea and exploits have been creditably carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il, the magazine said.
					
					 It stressed that the revolutionary history of the President is going on in reality of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
						
Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in the Czech Republic and Peru on March 25 and 28 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 Miroslav Czervinka, chairman of the Nymburk County Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia, said that Kim Il Sung devoted all his life to the national liberation of the Korean people and the socialist cause and made great exploits in the course. 
					
					 We believe that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people will frustrate every move of the U.S. and its followers to stifle the DPRK and surely build a thriving socialist nation, he added. 
					
					 The governor of a district in Lima City of Peru said that they deem it honor to significantly commemorate the birthday of Kim Il Sung, eternal leader of the Korean people. He expressed the will to strive for further development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. 
					
					 Carlos Roca, international secretary of the American Popular Revolutionary Alliance of Peru, recalled his visit to the DPRK with deep emotion during which he was received by the President. I can not forget forever the boundlessly warm love and benevolence shown by the President, he said.

articles.title: Russian President on Issue of Aircraft Manufacture
articles.content:
Russian President on Issue of Aircraft Manufacture
 Moscow, April 2 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev referred to the issue of aircraft manufacture at a meeting held on April 1.
					 He underscored the need to modernize the field of aircraft manufacture, improve the quality of aircraft by updating technology and streamline the aircraft production.
					
					 Saying that Russia has a lot of experience and designing schools to do so, he called for making an effective use of everything.

articles.title: Sudanese President Issues Decree on Darfur Status
articles.content:
Sudanese President Issues Decree on Darfur Status
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Sudanese President Omar Hassan Ahmed al-Bashir on March 29 issued a Republican Decree on conducting a referendum to decide the permanent administrative status of Sudan's Darfur region. 
					 According to the decree, the permanent status for Darfur will be decided via a referendum to be conducted simultaneously in three Darfur states. The referendum will be on two options whether the region should remain on its current status or should it be united as one Darfur region.
					
					 It is said that the administrative status of the Darfur region constitutes a major issue as some Darfur rebel groups demand that Darfur be one region instead of three states.

articles.title: Fiji PM Emphasizes Importance of Melanesian Solidarity
articles.content:
Fiji PM Emphasizes Importance of Melanesian Solidarity
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Fiji's Prime Minister Commodore Voreqe Bainimarama emphasized the importance of solidarity among Melanesian Spearhead Group (MSG) countries for regional development. He said this at the 18th MSG summit on Mar. 31.
					 Bainimarama called for regional cooperation, understanding and assistance while seeking to improve the living conditions of peoples.
					
					 Bainimarama said that the Melanesian group has the bulk of the Southern Pacific Island population and bulk of the trade and natural resources. "We must shoulder this responsibility with wisdom, collaboration and respect for their sovereignty."

articles.title: Iran, Lebanon Call for Consolidation of Their Relations
articles.content:
Iran, Lebanon Call for Consolidation of Their Relations 
						
Tehran, April 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian Parliament Speaker Ali Larijani and Lebanese Minister of Foreign Affairs and Immigrants Ali Shami called for strengthening relations between the two countries on March 28. This call was made at the meeting between Larijani and Shami visiting Iran.
					 They stressed the need to further consolidate all-out relations between the two countries and reinvigorate the unity and solidarity among the regional nations.

articles.title: Uruguay, Venezuela Agree to Promote South American Integration
articles.content:
Uruguay, Venezuela Agree to Promote South American Integration
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan President Jose Mujica and his Venezuelan counterpart Hugo Chavez on a visit to Uruguay said on Mar. 30 they agreed to strengthen initiatives to promote South American integration.
					 The Union of South American Nations (Unasur) must be built on a solid base, Chavez said.
					
					 Chavez said it was necessary to strengthen bilateral ties between the two countries, saying it was a way to deepen regional integration.

articles.title: Chavez Calls for Unity against US Imperialism
articles.content:
Chavez Calls for Unity against US Imperialism
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez on Thursday called on South American countries to unite against the "imperialism" of the United States. This call was made at a press conference during his visit to Bolivia
					 "The empire is going crazy and it's a real threat to world peace as the imperialism has entered its phase of extreme craziness," Chavez said.
					
					 Chavez said that it was important that countries in South America consolidate themselves as a region of peace before the threat of their northern neighbor.

articles.title: US Dams and Bridges in Poor Condition
articles.content:
US Dams and Bridges in Poor Condition
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- Dams and bridges remain in poor condition, causing a big trouble in the U.S.
					 According to a recent issue of New York Times, almost dams in the country were built so long ago that two dams are put at a dangerous situation while one dam is repaired. Over a quarter of the bridges across the country are very old.
					
					 What is problematic is that the government has not taken relevant steps at all till people are killed, the paper said.

articles.title: Indian Population Hits 1.21 Billion
articles.content:
Indian Population Hits 1.21 Billion
						
 Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- India's population has attained 1.21 billion, according to results of the 2010 census released on Mar. 31.
					 This was released by the Commissioner of Registrar General of India and Census C. Chandramauli.

articles.title: Acto de trabajadores agricolas por el 9 de abril
articles.content:
Acto de trabajadores agricolas por el 9 de abril
						
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en la comuna de Unhung del distrito de Thaechon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte el acto de los trabajadores agricolas en homenaje al 18o aniversario de la eleccion (9 de abril) del Dirigente Kim Jong Il como Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El presidente del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea, Ri Myong Gil, presento el informe y otras personas intervinieron.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que la eleccion del Dirigente en el cargo cimero de defensa nacional devino la firme garantia de cumplimiento satisfactorio de la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en el monte Paektu.
					
					Subrayaron que el Dirigente fortalecio la RPDC en el Estado del Presidente Kim Il Sung y logro notables exitos en la revolucion y la construccion practicando la politica de Songun.
					
					Continuaron que en cada periodo y etapa del desarrollo de la revolucion, el Dirigente condujo incansablemente la lucha por realizar la politica agricola del partido.
					
					Exhortaron a todos los trabajadores agricolas a alcanzar sin falta la meta de produccion de cereales de este ano bien conscientes de que tienen la responsabilidad de resolver la cuestion vital para el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y a dedicar su pasion patriotica a la construccion de una patria prospera.

articles.title: Islote Tok es territorio inseparable de Corea, comenta ATCC
articles.content:
Islote Tok es territorio inseparable de Corea, comenta ATCC
						
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- En estos dias, se tornan cada dia mas abiertos los movimientos de reaccionarios japoneses para arrebatar el islote Tok.
					El 30 de marzo, las autoridades japonesas ordenaron reflejar su reclamo por la "soberania del islote Tok" en los nuevos manuales de escuela secundaria para 2011 y diversificarlos.
					
					A adelantar la conclusion, esto es una violacion flagrante y crimen agresivo contra la soberania de Corea.
					
					El islote Tok es intocable territorio coreano.
					
					Corea fue la primera en descubrirlo e incorporarlo.
					
					Ademas, en virtud de la ley contemporanea, ratifico tambien primero su soberania sobre el Tok y la proclamo al interior y al exterior del pais.
					
					En los mapas elaborados por EE.UU. y Gran Bretana despues del fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial para determinar el territorio de Japon, el islote Tok esta anotado evidentemente como territorio coreano.
					
					En los mapas hechos anteriormente, en particular, en 1877 y en 1899 por los organos oficiales de Japon, el Tok aparece excluido del territorio japones. 
					
					Los hechos historicos comprueban que la sociedad internacional y hasta Japon reconocieron ya que el islote Tok es territorio propio de Corea.
					
					   Por lo tanto, las tentativas de Japon de usurparlo no se deben a la ignorancia del derecho internacional o a la equivocacion de datos historicos sino parten de su ambicion de agredir a Corea.
					
					Mediante la toma del Tok, Japon pretende convertirlo en la base avanzada en funcion de la reagresion a la RPDC y otros paises asiaticos y ganar todos los intereses economicos como ricos recursos maritimos y submarinos en aguas perifericas.
					
					Para ese fin, inspira la idea militarista a los habitantes, jovenes y ninos a traves de la educacion en la historia tergiversada para formarlos como brigada de choque en la usurpacion del islote Tok y la guerra de agresion.
					
					Esto es el mayor crimen que comete Japon hoy en dia ante la epoca y la historia.
					
					El problema resulta mas grave porque todo eso se comete bajo el control directo del gobierno japones.
					
					No se puede tolerar jamas tales maniobras de Japon que tiene la responsabilidad de pedir disculpas e indemnizar sus crimenes cometidos en el pasado contra el pueblo coreano.
					
					El islote Tok sera siempre territorio sagrado de Corea.

articles.title: Comienzo de turismo a famosos lugares
articles.content:
Comienzo de turismo a famosos lugares 
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- En Corea se reinicio el turismo a los lugares famosos en las zonas del noroeste y el Mar Oeste.
					Los turistas visitan primero el pintoresco monte Myohyang, que ocupa 375 kilometros cuadrados de area, cuyo pico principal es el Piro, situado entre el distrito de Hyangsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del  Norte, el distrito de Nyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur y la ciudad de Huichon de la provincia de Jagang. 
					
					Los turistas visitan tambien las zonas de recreo del monte Jangsu, el monte Kuwol y el monte Ryong-ak.
					
					Se incrementa el numero de los visitantes a las cuevas Song-am y Ryongmun.
					
					Al pasar momentos de descanso en tales lugares famosos, los trabajadores de distintos estratos conocen bien el paisaje natural hermoso, la historia y la cultura de la patria y sienten la superioridad del regimen socialista coreano. 
					
					De acuerdo con la creciente demanda de la gente a la vida cultural, en Corea se diversifican las formas y el contenido de turismo.

articles.title: Se renuevan los jardines circulares de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Se renuevan los jardines circulares de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- En estos dias, se reforman los jardines circulares en las avenidas principales de esta capital.
					En el centro del jardin frente al Parque de Sanghung se plantan los arboles del incienso que seran rodeados por arbustos o flores.
					
					En los espacios blancos se formara el cesped dorado y se instalaran en un intervalo determinado las lamparillas de adorno.
					
					Marcha a buen ritmo el mismo trabajo en los jardines frente al Hospital Kim Man Yu, en el contorno del Monumento a la Inmortalidad del municipio de Songyo y en la puerta Pothong y la avenida Mansudae.
					
					Al frente de la renovacion de jardines, estan la Direccion de Forestacion del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, el municipio Taedonggang, el Sosong, el Songyo y otros.

articles.title: Floricultura de la nacion coreana
articles.content:
Floricultura de la nacion coreana 
Pyongyang, 4 de abril (ATCC) -- La nacion coreana viene cultivando muchas flores desde la antiguedad.
					Segun el libro "Historia de los Tres Reinos", los coreanos cultivaban endrino ya en el periodo de Coguryo.
					
					En la epoca de los Tres Reinos, existia una costumbre de regalar flores a los enamorados y personas respetables.
					
					En los tiempos de Coryo y la dinastia de los Ri,  la floricultura estaba de moda tambien entre la poblacion humilde. 
					
					En el verano las coreanas pintaban en rojo sus unas con balsamina.
					
					En el periodo de Coryo, las flores servian de adorno siendo colocadas en el florero, cabello, sombrero, ropa, etc.
					
					En la dinastia de los Ri, se utilizaban para expresar el enamoramiento. 
					
					Los coreanos preferian sobre todo las flores oriundas de su tierra natal.
					
					En particular, les gustaban mas el crisantemo y otras flores que no se marchitan aun bajo la nieve y escarcha.
